definition: wake (trailing behind a ship, airplane etc)/slipstream
tail/remainder/remnant/extremity/sixth of the 28 constellations/classifier for fish
horse's tail/pointed posterior section of a locust etc
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: The development of junction vortex and wake of sail along the body are discussed.
sentences.chinese: 对接合部涡与围壳尾流沿艇体的发展进行了分析。

sentences.english: The ride was smooth until they got into the merchant ship's wake.
sentences.chinese: 航行一直很顺利，直到他们碰上了商船的尾流。

sentences.english: Braking is not as effective when travelling in another car's slipstream .
sentences.chinese: 处在前车的尾流中时，刹车不再那么有效。

sentences.english: ON THE WING The wake of a hovering rufous hummingbird, top.
sentences.chinese: 棕煌蜂鸟悬停时引发的尾流。

definition: to diverge (from bearing, flight path etc)/off course/to yaw
the front (nose) of a plane etc
the rear (tail) of a plane etc
empennage (of an aircraft)/fletching (of an arrow)/fins (of a missile, rocket etc)/rear spoiler (of a car)
